items.title: Three countries are ‘willing and capable’ of assassinating political dissidents on Australian soil, Asio head warns
items.standfirst: Spy chief Mike Burgess says it’s possible the unnamed regimes ‘would try to hide their involvement’ in any killingsGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastForeign agents from at least three countries are “willing and capable” of assassinating perceived political dissidents on Australian soil, Australia’s spy chief Mike Burgess has claimed.While not naming the three countries on Tuesday evening, Burgess, the director general of the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation, warned of the risk of a politically motivated assassination in Australia and said: “This threat is real.” Continue reading...

clusters.title: Twelve protesters charged after confrontation with police at Sydney weapons expo
clusters.neutral_headline: Protesters Charged After Sydney Weapons Expo Confrontation
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian Australia, ABC News Australia

items.title: Twelve protesters charged after confrontation with police at Sydney weapons expo
items.standfirst: Police and demonstrators both claim they were ‘set upon’ as pepper spray deployed outside event Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastTwelve people have been charged after an allegedly violent confrontation between New South Wales police and protesters outside a state government-sponsored defence conference in Sydney.Both police officers and protesters were allegedly injured at Palestine Action Group’s demonstration on Tuesday outside the Indo Pacific International Maritime Exposition at the International Convention Centre (ICC) in Darling Harbour, amid criticism that Israel’s largest weapons companies were attending the event.A 27-year-old man charged with refusing/failing to comply with direction and assault police officer in execution of duty without actual bodily harm. He was refused bail to appear before court tomorrow.A 26-year-old woman charged with four counts of assaulting police in execution of duty. She was refused bail to appear before court tomorrow.A 26-year-old man charged with hindering or resisting police officer in the execution of duty and refusing/failing to comply with direction. He was granted conditional bail to appear before Downing centre local court on 3 December.A 28-year-old man charged with assaulting a police officer in execution of duty without actual bodily harm. He was granted conditional bail to appear before court on 11 December.Four people were charged with refusing/failing to comply with direction and were granted conditional bail before hearings in December.Two men aged 23 and 34, and a 32-year-old woman were charged with hindering police and were granted conditional bail before hearings on 11 November.A 33-year-old man was charged with using offensive language near a public place or school. He was granted conditional bail before a hearing on 11 December. Continue reading...
items.content: Police and demonstrators both claim they were ‘set upon’ as pepper spray deployed outside event Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastTwelve people have been charged after an allegedly violent confrontation between New South Wales police and protesters outside a state government-sponsored defence conference in Sydney.Both police officers and protesters were allegedly injured at Palestine Action Group’s demonstration on Tuesday outside the Indo Pacific International Maritime Exposition at the International Convention Centre (ICC) in Darling Harbour, amid criticism that Israel’s largest weapons companies were attending the event.A 27-year-old man charged with refusing/failing to comply with direction and assault police officer in execution of duty without actual bodily harm. He was refused bail to appear before court tomorrow.A 26-year-old woman charged with four counts of assaulting police in execution of duty. She was refused bail to appear before court tomorrow.A 26-year-old man charged with hindering or resisting police officer in the execution of duty and refusing/failing to comply with direction. He was granted conditional bail to appear before Downing centre local court on 3 December.A 28-year-old man charged with assaulting a police officer in execution of duty without actual bodily harm. He was granted conditional bail to appear before court on 11 December.Four people were charged with refusing/failing to comply with direction and were granted conditional bail before hearings in December.Two men aged 23 and 34, and a 32-year-old woman were charged with hindering police and were granted conditional bail before hearings on 11 November.A 33-year-old man was charged with using offensive language near a public place or school. He was granted conditional bail before a hearing on 11 December. Continue reading...

items.title: Twelve people charged as hundreds of pro-Palestine protesters gather at Sydney weapons expo – video
items.standfirst: Twelve people have been charged after hundreds gathered to demonstrate against a state-government sponsored defence conference in Sydney, amid criticism that Israel’s largest weapons companies were attending the event. Footage shows people chanting 'hands off the West Bank' and 'hands off Gaza' outside the Indo Pacific International Maritime Exposition in Darling Harbour. The Palestine Action Group had planned to blockade the expo, but dozens of uniformed and mounted officers surrounded the ICC to prevent the event from being disruptedTen arrested as police pepper spray protesters who tried to blockade Sydney weapons expo Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve people have been charged after hundreds gathered to demonstrate against a state-government sponsored defence conference in Sydney, amid criticism that Israel’s largest weapons companies were attending the event. Footage shows people chanting 'hands off the West Bank' and 'hands off Gaza' outside the Indo Pacific International Maritime Exposition in Darling Harbour. The Palestine Action Group had planned to blockade the expo, but dozens of uniformed and mounted officers surrounded the ICC to prevent the event from being disruptedTen arrested as police pepper spray protesters who tried to blockade Sydney weapons expo Continue reading...

items.content: Dozens of demonstrators from Palestine Action Group rallied outside the Sydney International Convention Centre on Tuesday morning.

clusters.title: Hundreds of discounted cars up for sale - but there's a catch
clusters.neutral_headline: Discounted Cars Available, Potential Buyers Should Research

items.title: Hundreds of discounted cars up for sale - but there's a catch
items.standfirst: Queenslanders in the market for a new car could take advantage of hail sales at dealerships and auction houses.
items.content: Queenslanders in the market for a new car could take advantage of hail sales at dealerships and auction houses.

items.title: Hundreds of discounted cars to go up for sale - but there's a catch
items.standfirst: Experts are warning prospective buyers to do their research before making a purchase.
items.content: Queensland car dealerships are set to mark down the price of hundreds of hail-damaged vehicles but experts are warning prospective buyers to do their research before making a purchase.Businesses have marked down the vehicles with discounts ranging from $1000 to $10,000 after a supercell storm swept through the state's south-east.However, RACQ principal technical researcher Andrew Kirk is urging drivers to factor in the potential cost of repairs, assess how water damage could impact the vehicle and check if the car can be comprehensively insured.READ MORE: History made as Half Yours wins Melbourne Cup"We would recommend talking to your insurer prior to purchasing, just to make sure that you are then able to reinsure that vehicle with pre-existing damage," Kirk said.Repair costs can vary and cars with some light hail damage can be repaired using paintless dent removal."You don't have to repaint the vehicle, it's just pushing the dents back out," Kirk said.Almost 200 new and used vehicles are being discounted as part of a snap hail sale at Wynnum car dealership Bartons.Discounts will also be available at upcoming auctions.READ MORE: RBA dodges Cup Day surprise but makes rates vowManheims at Eagle Farm expects to receive 300 to 400 hail-damaged cars from insurance companies in the coming weeks."Some vehicles you can save up to $10,000," Manheim director of operations Sean Kinsey said.Vehicles classed as repairable write-offs will be able to be re-registered and driven again after being fixed up."You change the glass, repair any light damage or anything like that, go through an inspection process and then you can literally put the car back on the road," Kinsey said.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: Queensland residents can find discounted cars at dealerships and auction houses.
Experts advise prospective buyers to conduct thorough research before purchasing.
Hail sales are a reason for the discounted prices.
The sales are a way to clear out inventory.
Buyers should be aware of potential issues.

clusters.title: Lone survivor of Air India crash says 'God took all my happiness'
clusters.neutral_headline: Air India Crash Survivor Shares Anguish

items.title: Lone survivor of Air India crash says 'God took all my happiness'

items.title: Worker dies after dramatic rescue from Italian medieval tower collapse
